result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert J Gallo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, deft requests credit for 145 days.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $40.00 plus surcharges.
DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

deft placed on probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Matt Perz.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3yrs.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  If revoked, deft requests credit for 145 days.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $40.
Sentencing hearing on March 23, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Defense counsel out ill; sentencing hrg removed from the court's calendar this afternoon; DA's office notified & conveyance notified

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Matt Perz.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1 as charged - 2nd & subsequent offense.  Count 2 is dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 3/12/15 @ 2:30pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty Perz appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  Atty Perz reports the case is not settled; requests an adjournment - waiting for discovery (signed release to obtain records from JS).  Per Court, leave on for JS for 1/26/15 @ 9am.  Parties to notify the court in writing by 1/20/15 if the case is settled; no plea bargaining will be allowed after 1/20/15.
Scheduling order - (sent to parties on 11/12/14)

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Matt Perz. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by Atty. Perz.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 12-11-14 @ 10:00am. Jury selection on 1-26-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
Matt Perz

123pm
  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Renner.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 11/6/14 @ 900am.  $1500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
